intro: Pyrus paxiana, commonly known as the Sierra Madre pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of western North America, particularly in California and Arizona. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a serrated margin, while its flowers are white and appear in clusters. The fruit is a small, edible pear that ripens in the fall and is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky habitats.
